thread.title_full: Crews On Scene Of Water Main Break In Hoboken « CBS New York

title: Crews On Scene Of Water Main Break In Hoboken « CBS New York
text:
Crews On Scene Of Water Main Break In Hoboken February 28, 2017 6:38 AM Filed Under: Hoboken 
HOBOKEN, N.J. (CBSNewYork) — Crews are on the scene of a water main break that is causing some heavy flooding in Hoboken. 
The break happened at 5th Street and Willow Avenue just before 5 a.m. Tuesday morning. #Hoboken , there is a water main break at 5th and Willow. Additional details will be provided soon. 
— SUEZ Water NJ (@SUEZwaterNJ) February 28, 2017 
The break has sent water gushing into the streets and some customers are reporting little or no water pressure, CBS2’s Jim Smith reported. Willow Avenue and Clinton Street are closed between 4th and 6th streets. NJ TRANSIT 126 buses are being detoured to Washington Street. 
Stay with CBSNewYork.com as this story continues to develop.
